- Thursday: Mostly sunny and very cold, with a high of 20 and low of 16 degrees. â›„ï¸ Brr!

ðŸ“° News we're reading
1. Local tow company rescues over 40 drivers after first snowfall (wandtv.com) â€” Decatur's TMG Towing & Recovery had a busy weekend rescuing over 40 drivers after the first snowfall of the season. The company, which offers free services to seniors and veterans, advises residents to stay home during snowstorms.
2. Contegra Construction wraps construction on 611,000-square-foot warehouse in Decatur (rejournals.com) â€” McLeod Express has opened a massive 611,000-square-foot warehouse in Decatur constructed by Contegra Construction. This new facility, located near key transport routes, expands their warehousing capabilities to meet growing demand.
3. Expansion Decatur Baseball Club looks for new name from community (wcia.com) â€” Decatur is set to welcome a new summer collegiate baseball team, thanks to a partnership between Golden Rule Entertainment, the City of Decatur, and Millikin University. The community is invited to help name the team, which will play at Workman Family Baseball Field starting in 2026.
4. Decatur Park District, Lindsey Communities, partner for new Adult Day Services program (wcia.com) â€” A new Adult Day Center, called 'The Lindsey Life Center,' is coming to Decatur through a partnership between the Decatur Park District and Lindsey Communities. This initiative aims to provide essential services and social engagement for older adults in the community.
5. Court Tosses Fatal DUI Charge for Man Accused of Hitting 12-Year-Old (newschannel20.com) â€” A Decatur court has dismissed a DUI charge against Hassan Woods, accused of fatally hitting a 12-year-old cyclist. The charge was dismissed without prejudice, allowing for potential refiling, while Woods remains under strict pretrial conditions.
